post.description:
This endpoint provides the capability to calculate the CO2 emission for one or multiple transport legs. The endpoint supports different emission standards and input data types. The used combination should be provided in the ```name``` and ```type``` property.       
 For example, ```NL``` and ```consumption``` should be used to calculate and/or allocate emission if your data availability includes fuel consumption and you want to use the NL emission standard      
>Note: Emissions should be calculated with one unique modality per request.

calculation.name: GLEC
calculation.vehicleType: Artic truck up to 34 t GVW

post.description:
This endpoint provides the capability to allocate emission to one or multiple shipments. The endpoint expects a list of transport legs (or trips) which are used to calculate the total emission. Additionally, it expects a list of consignments related to these legs.        The API will allocate the total emission to the corresponding list of consignments based on the chosen framework ```name``` and calculation ```type```.        

 This endpoint supports different emission standards and input data.        
 For example, ```GLEC``` and ```intensity``` should be used to calculate and allocate emission if your data availability does not include fuel consumption and you want to use the GLEC emission standard.        

 Emissions can be allocated by either:        
 - using ```GreaterCircleDistance```, as recommended by EN-16258 and NL        
 - using ```PlannedDistance``` as recommended by GLEC.       

The allocation method can be set by providing the ```allocationMethod```, which defaults to ```GreaterCircleDistance```        
 In case of ```PlannedDistance```, the BigMile Route API calculates a planned distance between the provided origin and destination coordinates
This endpoint provides the capability to calculate the CO2 emission for one or multiple locations. The endpoint supports consumption based and intensity based calculations.

This endpoint provides the capability to allocate location emission to one or multiple shipments. The endpoint expects a list of locations which are used to calculate the total emission. Additionally, it expects a list of consignments related to these legs.     The API will allocate the total emission to the corresponding list of consignments based on the chosen framework ```name``` and calculation ```type```.     

 This endpoint supports different emission standards and input data

503.description: The Health Check is not successful

info.title: BigMile Emission API
info.description:
BigMile is a calculation and analysis platform which logistics service providers                     and shippers can use to optimize and report on their multimodal transport related CO2 emissions.                     

 The BigMile Emission API is a webservice to instantly receive allocated emission related to your shipments or trips.

x-logo.altText: The standard in CO2 footprint optimization.

tags.name: Transport Emissions
tags.description:
The BigMile emission API contains two features: emission calculation and emission allocation.       
 * Calculation determines the total emission of one or multiple transport legs.       
 * Allocation determines the total emission of one or multiple trips and allocates it to individual shipments       


 The API supports different types of input data, such as:       
 * Default input data. No fuel information is available.       
 * Primary input data. Fuel consumption is available.       


 Additionally, the API supports different emission standards, such as:       
 * Dutch factors       
 * UK factors       
 * GLEC framework       


 When choosing to use the API, you need to provide:       
 1. The framework name in ```name```       
 2. The ```type``` of input data, e.g. consumption or intensity       
 For example, name: ```NL``` and type: ```consumption``` should be used to calculate and/or allocate emission if your data availability includes fuel consumption and you want to use the NL emission standard.

status.description: The status code of the error.

path.description: The path where the error has occured.

calculation.description: The calculation input variables. A maximum of 10 calculations can be send in a single request.

lang.description: The language that has been used for the calculation.

name.description: The framework name that has been applied for calculation.

type.description: The calculation type that has been applied for calculation.

frameworkVariant.description: The framework variant that has been applied for calculation.

modality.description: The modality that has been used for calculation.

roadCategory.description: The road category that has been used for calculation.

originTradelane.description: The origin sea freight container tradelane that has been used for calculation.

destinationTradelane.description: The destination sea freight container tradelane that has been used for calculation.

haulType.description: The air freight haul type that has been used for calculation.

temperatureControlled.description: The indicator whether transport is temperature controlled.

uplifts.description: Indicates if any uplift factors have been applied to this calculation

usedDistance.description: The distance in kilometers used during the calculation, includes corrections when required.

legs.description: Total kg CO2e emission per legId.

totalCO2eWTW.description: Total kg CO2e Well-To-Wheel emission of all legs.

totalCO2eTTW.description: Total kg CO2e Tank-To-Wheel emission of all legs.

consumption.description: An object containing the used consumption type.

consumptionType.description:
The consumption calculation type:     
 - Using a fuel quantity in liters (l).     
 - Using a fuel consumption in (km/l) and distance (either actualDistance or plannedDistance needs to be provided).

countryCode.description: The location of the transport. Only used in the framework ```GLEC``` and a fueltype related to electricity is used

year.description: The year of the transport. Only used in the framework ```GLEC``` and a fueltype related to electricity is used

fuelQuantity.description: Quantity in the unit defined in fuelType.

consumptionType.description:
The consumption calculation type:     
 - Using a fuel quantity in liters (l).     
 - Using a fuel consumption in (km/l) and distance (either actualDistance or plannedDistance needs to be provided).

countryCode.description: The location of the transport. Only used in the framework ```GLEC``` and a fueltype related to electricity is used

year.description: The year of the transport. Only used in the framework ```GLEC``` and a fueltype related to electricity is used

fuelCategory.description: The used fuel category, only relevant in case of GLEC framework.

loadCharacteristicCategory.description:
The used load characteristic category. 

> **Note** that this is only applicable for:       
> - name: `GLEC`       
> - modality: `Rail`       
> - Origin and Destination are not in North America

roadCategory.description:
The used smartWay road category. 

> **Note** that this is only applicable for:       
> - name: `GLEC`       
> - modality: `Road`       
> - Origin or Destination is in North America

amount.description: The amount shipped (in terms of the unit).

temperatureControlled.description:
Whether or not the cargo/location is temperature controlled. 

> **Note** that this is only applicable for name `GLEC` and type `intensity` framework.      
> The default for `GLEC` `intensity` is `true`

amount.description: The amount shipped (in terms of the unit).

CO2perUnitKM.description: The amount of CO2e WTW emission per unit KM
